title: Heimerdinger is the cure to Bronze.
body:

I've played Heimer in high gold.

You just need to adapt your strategy to how your opponent deals with your turrets.

If they don't do anything and just let you push, take the tower and force enemy jungle pressure (and at least go even if they actually attempt a gank) or push out and roam.  Heimer and actually pull off decent ganks on top if you're on blue side by going around behind and placing turrets between them and their tower.
If they try to kill your turrets as soon as possible, wait for them to start going for your turret and throw your grenade and rockets at them.
If they use their spells to kill your turrets from long range, accept the trade because they'll run out of mana way faster than you will, and likely miss cs at the same time.  When they're forced to recall, you can use your ulted turret to take the tower if the enemy jungler doesn't cover the lane.  If the jungler does cover the lane, steal his raptors while he's csing under tower.

I'll admit that he does get weaker as your opponents become more and more skilled, but you can still play around that to a point.  I haven't played Heimer in plat though as I got too annoyed with his turret ai for a while.  I imagine he can still work, but it would require more precise planning and jungler coordination to be really successful.

Heimer has counters just like most healthy champions.  It takes him time to do damage to anyone so assassins that can burst him down quickly or become invulnerable while they do damage are quite effective.  Also there are several champions in game that can move his turrets.  Most of these also do AOE damage so they counter him well.  Finally the new assassin item that provides a channeled spell shield may very well push Heimer to trash tier as he tends to be very weak if he cannot land his long cd hard to aim sole crowd control grenade.

Despite what most counter guides say one of his best counters is {{champion:245}} (a good one). If heim does any obvious patterns like stand in the middle of his turrets or set them up too close a good w>e>q combo will get him to back off from poking. If the patterns continue just do the same and invite an ally. Only problem is farming relies solely on q or using q to get rid of turrets. Sometimes all your cs will probably be his turrets, or you could just roam :P.
